hypothesis_content.title: Altcoin Intraday Reversal on Extreme BTC Dominance Spike
hypothesis_content.statement: A rapid, intraday spike in BTC Dominance (1h increase > 0.75%) during NEUTRAL/BEAR regimes triggers a short-term mean reversion flow back into major altcoins (ETH, SOL), providing a long entry signal.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Sharp, panic-driven flights to BTC dominance are often overdone intraday. They represent a temporary capital rotation, not a sustained trend, especially in non-BULL regimes. This creates a snap-back opportunity in high-liquidity alts as the rotation exhausts.
entry_conditions: Simultaneously, aggregate altcoin index (e.g., TOTAL3 - BTC cap) is down on the 1h candle
Enter long on an equal-weight basket of ETH and SOL at the close of the triggering 1h candle

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC.D retraces 50% of its initial 1h spike
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC.D continues up, making a new 4h high post-trigger

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The average 6-hour return of the ETH/SOL basket after the trigger is <= 0%.
